All-you-can-eat buffets attract gourmet and value-conscious diners in France's city centers
subhead: Once mainly found near shopping centers, restaurants offering all-you-can-eat buffets, a model focusing on conviviality, comfort and an abundance of food, have started to open in Paris, Lyon and Bordeaux.

French fraud watchdog reports Shein for 'childlike' sex dolls
subhead: France's anti-fraud unit stated on Saturday that it had reported Shein for selling dolls that made it 'difficult to doubt the child pornography nature of the content.' Shortly thereafter, Shein removed the dolls from its online platform and announced the launch of an internal inquiry.

title: The Italian city of Lucca is drawing thousands of cosplayers
subhead: The Lucca Comics & Games Festival, dedicated to comics and gaming, runs until November 2 and hosts one of the world's largest pop culture gatherings. This year's edition pays tribute to France.

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear a sleeveless puffer vest?
subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

title: Before the Louvre heist, security at European museums was already a major concern
subhead: France is not the only country to have experienced a 'heist of the century,' nor the only one to question the protection of artworks on public display.

Water rises and land sinks in Vietnam's Mekong Delta
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (5/6) The Mekong Delta and Ho Chi Minh City, home to a third of Vietnam's population, face rising seas and the toll of decades of resource overuse, leaving much of the delta at risk of submersion.

title: Western Sahara: Morocco secures diplomatic victory at the UN
subhead: The United Nations Security Council adopted a resolution on Friday that recognizes Rabat's autonomy plan as the main reference point in the search for a solution to a conflict that has long poisoned the geopolitics of North Africa.

title: Egypt opens Grand Egyptian Museum, centerpiece of its tourism industry
subhead: The colossal project dates back to the 1990s. The huge site, next to the pyramids of Giza, is billed as the largest museum in the world dedicated to a single civilization. It opens on November 1 after years of delays.
